#EricAdams
NYC Mayor Eric Adams Finally Lifts COVID Vaccine Mandates for Public Employees‚Äîbut Won‚Äôt Automatically Reinstate Thousands of Fired Workers
Red State ^ | 02/06/2023 | Bob Hoge
https://redstate.com/bobhoge/2023/02/06/nyc-mayor-eric-adams-finally-lifts-covid-vaccine-mandates-for-public-employees-but-wont-automatically-reinstate-thousands-of-fired-workers-n699615

New York City Mayor Eric Adams said in a statement Monday that the Big Apple is dropping its mandatory COVID-19 vaccine mandate for public employees‚Äîbut also said that the nearly 2,000 people fired for refusing the vax will not automatically get their jobs back and instead will have to reapply.

It‚Äôs exactly this kind of capricious and cruel response that has made so many Americans distrustful of COVID policies from the Federal Government to the local level.

Adams tweeted out the news:

With more than 96 percent of city workers and more than 80 percent of New Yorkers having received their primary #COVID19 series and more tools readily available to keep us healthy, the #COVID19 Vaccination Will Become Optional for City Workers.

Read more: https://t.co/OSuNs7Deku

‚Äî Mayor Eric Adams (@NYCMayor) February 6, 2023

The mayor said in his statement:

‚Ä¶this is the right moment for this decision.

No, the ‚Äúright moment‚Äù for this decision was years ago. In fact, the requirement to inject oneself with Pfizer BioNTech mRNA shots that are not even to this day approved by the FDA (they‚Äôre still under ‚Äúemergency use authorization‚Äù if you can believe that) should never have been mandated in the first place. Adams continued:

I continue to urge every New Yorker to get vaccinated, get boosted, and take the necessary steps to protect themselves and those around them from COVID-19.

Any ounce of credibility Adams still had evaporated with that one sentence. Who in their right mind would be urging every New Yorker to receive a vaccine and/or booster that is ineffective and potentially dangerous? The people who are still holding on to this vaccine-as-cure-all fantasy truly seem delusional at this point.

But what about the 1,780 city workers who were summarily fired when they refused the shot? Well, they won‚Äôt get back pay, for starters, and they will have to reapply if they want their old positions back. If they‚Äôre rehired, will they start at the same salary they had when they were axed? Will they retain whatever rank or seniority they had earned? It‚Äôs not clear at this point.

‚Å¶@NYCMayor‚Å© not good enough people were fired, forced from their careers, homes, discriminated against or forced to put something in their body they did not want & some of them were harmed. #TheFinestUnfiltered https://t.co/pdapbABfYP

‚Äî John D. Macari Jr. üá∫üá∏üóΩ (@JohnDMacari) February 6, 2023

The NY Post reports on how the mandate affected one New York firefighter:

Jairo Sosa, 37, who worked for 7 1/2-years as a firefighter before his ‚Äúforced resignation,‚Äù said he would love to get his job back. He has a wife and three young kids ages 5, 3, and seven months old.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a great job. I love going out and serving my community. I was working in the same community I grew up in ‚Äî Washington Heights,‚Äù Sosa said.

He was awarded a medal in 2021 after rescuing a 5-year-old girl.

‚ÄúYou get a medal one year then you get terminated the year after,‚Äù Sosa said.

That‚Äôs just one story, but there are at least 1,779 more.

NYC Mayor Eric Adams had ended the vaccine mandate for city workers

Hundreds of people were stripped of their livelihood for refusing this mandate over the last two years and they will NOT be reinstated

Absolutely disgusting

‚Äî Clayton Keirns (@CKeirns) February 6, 2023

So much about the nation‚Äôs COVID policies on the federal, state, and local levels was outrageous and dictatorial, and firing thousands of people during one of the most trying times in their lives was flat-out wrong.

Admit your mistakes, Eric Adams, and restore these people‚Äôs jobs, back pay, and seniority.

New York City Mayor Eric Adams

_source.content: CONGRESSMAN Eric "Gang Bang on da Fang Fang" Swalwell has refused to say if he had sex with an alleged Chinese spy ‚Äî claiming the information is "classified".He was one of a number of Democrats targeted in a honey trap operation to infiltrate political circles, according to bombshell reports last night.Overseas student Christine Fang ‚Äî known as Fang Fang ‚Äî is said to have been taped by the FBI having sex with two Midwestern mayors.She also cozied up to a string of other politicians including presidential hopeful Tulsi Gabbard before mysteriously vanishing.Swalwell, who is now a member of the House Intelligence Committee, is the most high profile figure to be swept up in the alleged scandal.Last night Fox News anchor Tucker Carlson claimed security agencies believe he was in a sexual relationship with the suspected spy.And Donald Trump Jr told the show it meant Swalwell was a "threat to national security."Carlson told viewers: "US intelligence officials believe that Fang had a sexual relationship with Eric Swalwell."We asked Swalwell's office about that directly today."His staff replied by saying that they could not comment whether Swalwell had a sexual relationship with Fang, because that information might be, quote, classified."Swalwell, 40, was unmarried at the time he met Fang in around 2012. He would wed Brittany Watts in 2016.She is said to have raise funds and campaigned for him among Asian American voters as head of a student group.According to a report by Axios, he cut off contact with Fang after a "defensive briefing" from FBI agents who were investigating her.Swalwell's office told The Sun: "Rep Swalwell, long ago, provided information about this person ‚Äî whom he met more than eight years ago, and whom he hasn‚Äôt seen in nearly six years ‚Äî to the FBI."To protect information that might be classified, he will not participate in your story."There is a Reason this F##ktard is kicked Off of the Intelligence Committee.Same goes for Adam Schiff for Brains (D-CA)
_source.contentraw:
CONGRESSMAN Eric "Gang Bang on da Fang Fang" Swalwell has refused to say if he had sex with an alleged Chinese spy ‚Äî claiming the information is "classified".

He was one of a number of Democrats targeted in a honey trap operation to infiltrate political circles, according to bombshell reports last night.

Overseas student Christine Fang ‚Äî known as Fang Fang ‚Äî is said to have been taped by the FBI having sex with two Midwestern mayors.

She also cozied up to a string of other politicians including presidential hopeful Tulsi Gabbard before mysteriously vanishing.

Swalwell, who is now a member of the House Intelligence Committee, is the most high profile figure to be swept up in the alleged scandal.

Last night Fox News anchor Tucker Carlson claimed security agencies believe he was in a sexual relationship with the suspected spy.

And Donald Trump Jr told the show it meant Swalwell was a "threat to national security."

Carlson told viewers: "US intelligence officials believe that Fang had a sexual relationship with Eric Swalwell.

"We asked Swalwell's office about that directly today.

"His staff replied by saying that they could not comment whether Swalwell had a sexual relationship with Fang, because that information might be, quote, classified."

Swalwell, 40, was unmarried at the time he met Fang in around 2012. He would wed Brittany Watts in 2016.

She is said to have raise funds and campaigned for him among Asian American voters as head of a student group.

According to a report by Axios, he cut off contact with Fang after a "defensive briefing" from FBI agents who were investigating her.

Swalwell's office told The Sun: "Rep Swalwell, long ago, provided information about this person ‚Äî whom he met more than eight years ago, and whom he hasn‚Äôt seen in nearly six years ‚Äî to the FBI.

"To protect information that might be classified, he will not participate in your story."

There is a Reason this F##ktard is kicked Off of the Intelligence Committee.

Same goes for Adam Schiff for Brains (D-CA)

_source.content: Terrifying: Chinese ‚Äòspy balloons‚Äô seen as dry run for nuclear EMP attack(Natural News) The recent sightings of Chinese ‚Äúspy‚Äù balloons over the United States could be test runs by Beijing for a sneak attack on America using small nuclear explosions that set off massive power outages due to electromagnetic pulse bursts.‚ÄúHigh-altitude balloons, such as the one China has floated over mountain state military bases this week, are considered a key ‚Äòdelivery platform‚Äô for secret nuclear strikes on America‚Äôs electric grid, according to intelligence officials,‚Äù the Washington Examiner reported. ‚ÄúSpy balloons, used by Japan to drop bombs during World War II, are now far more sophisticated, can fly at up to 200,000 feet, evade detection, and can carry a small nuclear bomb that, if exploded in the atmosphere, would shut down the grid and wipe out electronics in a many-state-wide area.‚ÄùThe outlet reported further that a balloon-launched EMP attack threat was initially mentioned by a congressional commission and within the U.S. military a number of years ago. The American Leadership & Policy Foundation noted in a 2015 report written by Air Force Maj. David Stuckenberg, a top EMP expert, that such balloons are a major national security threat because of what they are capable of carrying.The report, titled ‚ÄúNovel High-altitude Delivery Platforms for Weapons of Mass Destruction/Weapons of Mass Effect,‚Äù notes:Can a state, pseudo-state or non-state actor(s) deliver Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD)/Weapons of Mass Effect (WME) to strategically impact America‚Äôs infrastructure absent employment of Inter-continental Ballistic Missiles (ICBM), SubmarineLaunched Ballistic Missiles (SBLM), or other conventional means? The answer is ‚Äúyes.‚Äù Thus, the feasibility of using novel delivery platforms to achieve offensive capabilities against the United States should be examined and understood by the emergency management and national security communities.‚ÄúWhile legacy and derivative systems such as Russia‚Äôs (oceanic multi-purpose Status-6 system) nuclear torpedo continue to present strategic threats to the U.S., their proliferation has proven somewhat predictable over time,‚Äù the report continued. ‚ÄúHowever, the rise of global terrorism has created a new dimension of risk to the U.S. in particular ‚Äì one that presents itself in a chaotic, innovative and ill-defined manner.‚ÄúConsequently, planners should begin addressing novel strategic threats by understanding what can be done rather than what has been done. Such an approach is critically important to protecting America‚Äôs society and critical infrastructure,‚Äù it added.‚ÄúUsing a balloon as a WMD/WME platform could provide adversaries with a pallet of altitudes and payload options with which to maximize offensive effects against the U.S.,‚Äù Stuckenberg wrote. ‚ÄúA high altitude balloon could be designed, created, and launched in a matter of months. There is nothing to prevent several hundred pounds of weapons material from being delivered to altitude.‚ÄùIn a short Friday interview with the Examiner, Stuckenberg said: ‚ÄúChina‚Äôs recent balloon flyover of the United States is clearly a provocative and aggressive act. It was most likely a type of dry run meant to send a strategic message to the USA. We must not take this for granted.‚ÄùDemocratic and Republican lawmakers are both demanding that the Biden regime explain why the balloon was allowed to enter U.S. airspace in the first place, let alone survive after it was reported by media outlets.Democratic Sen. Jon Tester of Montana, where the balloon was first reported to be on Thursday, said he‚Äôs planning on holding a hearing of the Defense Appropriations Subcommittee he chairs to get answers about the balloon incident.‚ÄúMontanans value their freedom and privacy and I‚Äôll always fight to defend both,‚Äù Tester said Friday. ‚ÄúChina‚Äôs actions are a clear threat to those values and to America‚Äôs national security, and I‚Äôm demanding answers from the Biden Administration. I will be pulling people before my committee to get real answers on how this happened, and how we can prevent it from ever happening again.‚ÄùSen. Eric Schmitt (R-Mo.) is also looking for answers after the balloon traversed his state on Friday.‚ÄúI‚Äôm calling for an investigation and demanding answers from the Biden Admin. on why a Chinese spy balloon was allowed to hover over critical military infrastructure in Missouri and across the interior of the U.S. without any intervention,‚Äù he tweeted.Sources include:http://CharlieKirk.comhttp://WashingtonExaminer.comhttps://www.naturalnews.com/2023-02-06-terrifying-chinese-spy-balloons-seen-as-dry-run-for-nuclear-emp-attack.html
_source.contentraw:
Terrifying: Chinese ‚Äòspy balloons‚Äô seen as dry run for nuclear EMP attack

(Natural News) The recent sightings of Chinese ‚Äúspy‚Äù balloons over the United States could be test runs by Beijing for a sneak attack on America using small nuclear explosions that set off massive power outages due to electromagnetic pulse bursts.

‚ÄúHigh-altitude balloons, such as the one China has floated over mountain state military bases this week, are considered a key ‚Äòdelivery platform‚Äô for secret nuclear strikes on America‚Äôs electric grid, according to intelligence officials,‚Äù the Washington Examiner reported. ‚ÄúSpy balloons, used by Japan to drop bombs during World War II, are now far more sophisticated, can fly at up to 200,000 feet, evade detection, and can carry a small nuclear bomb that, if exploded in the atmosphere, would shut down the grid and wipe out electronics in a many-state-wide area.‚Äù

The outlet reported further that a balloon-launched EMP attack threat was initially mentioned by a congressional commission and within the U.S. military a number of years ago. The American Leadership & Policy Foundation noted in a 2015 report written by Air Force Maj. David Stuckenberg, a top EMP expert, that such balloons are a major national security threat because of what they are capable of carrying.

The report, titled ‚ÄúNovel High-altitude Delivery Platforms for Weapons of Mass Destruction/Weapons of Mass Effect,‚Äù notes:

Can a state, pseudo-state or non-state actor(s) deliver Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD)/Weapons of Mass Effect (WME) to strategically impact America‚Äôs infrastructure absent employment of Inter-continental Ballistic Missiles (ICBM), SubmarineLaunched Ballistic Missiles (SBLM), or other conventional means? The answer is ‚Äúyes.‚Äù Thus, the feasibility of using novel delivery platforms to achieve offensive capabilities against the United States should be examined and understood by the emergency management and national security communities.

‚ÄúWhile legacy and derivative systems such as Russia‚Äôs (oceanic multi-purpose Status-6 system) nuclear torpedo continue to present strategic threats to the U.S., their proliferation has proven somewhat predictable over time,‚Äù the report continued. ‚ÄúHowever, the rise of global terrorism has created a new dimension of risk to the U.S. in particular ‚Äì one that presents itself in a chaotic, innovative and ill-defined manner.

‚ÄúConsequently, planners should begin addressing novel strategic threats by understanding what can be done rather than what has been done. Such an approach is critically important to protecting America‚Äôs society and critical infrastructure,‚Äù it added.

‚ÄúUsing a balloon as a WMD/WME platform could provide adversaries with a pallet of altitudes and payload options with which to maximize offensive effects against the U.S.,‚Äù Stuckenberg wrote. ‚ÄúA high altitude balloon could be designed, created, and launched in a matter of months. There is nothing to prevent several hundred pounds of weapons material from being delivered to altitude.‚Äù

In a short Friday interview with the Examiner, Stuckenberg said: ‚ÄúChina‚Äôs recent balloon flyover of the United States is clearly a provocative and aggressive act. It was most likely a type of dry run meant to send a strategic message to the USA. We must not take this for granted.‚Äù

Democratic and Republican lawmakers are both demanding that the Biden regime explain why the balloon was allowed to enter U.S. airspace in the first place, let alone survive after it was reported by media outlets.

Democratic Sen. Jon Tester of Montana, where the balloon was first reported to be on Thursday, said he‚Äôs planning on holding a hearing of the Defense Appropriations Subcommittee he chairs to get answers about the balloon incident.

‚ÄúMontanans value their freedom and privacy and I‚Äôll always fight to defend both,‚Äù Tester said Friday. ‚ÄúChina‚Äôs actions are a clear threat to those values and to America‚Äôs national security, and I‚Äôm demanding answers from the Biden Administration. I will be pulling people before my committee to get real answers on how this happened, and how we can prevent it from ever happening again.‚Äù

Sen. Eric Schmitt (R-Mo.) is also looking for answers after the balloon traversed his state on Friday.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm calling for an investigation and demanding answers from the Biden Admin. on why a Chinese spy balloon was allowed to hover over critical military infrastructure in Missouri and across the interior of the U.S. without any intervention,‚Äù he tweeted.

Sources include:

http://CharlieKirk.com

http://WashingtonExaminer.com

https://www.naturalnews.com/2023-02-06-terrifying-chinese-spy-balloons-seen-as-dry-run-for-nuclear-emp-attack.html

card.description: News that the Pentagon is tracking a Chinese spy balloon over the US is raising concerns about China‚Äôs espionage efforts against America and its citizens.
card.title: Not Just Spy Balloons: The CCP‚Äôs Expansive Spy Campaign Against America

_source.content: #China #EspionageNot Just the Spy Balloons: The CCP‚Äôs Expansive Spy Campaign Against AmericaEpoch Times ^ | 02/06/2023 | Andrew Thornebrookehttps://www.theepochtimes.com/not-just-balloons-the-ccps-expansive-spy-campaign-against-america_5032375.html?utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=ZeroHedge&src_src=partner&src_cmp=ZeroHedgeNews that the Pentagon was tracking a Chinese communist spy balloon hovering over the United States this week is raising concerns about the extent of China‚Äôs espionage efforts against America and its citizens.But just how far is the regime willing to go in order to spy on and undermine the United States?The espionage efforts of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP), which rules China as a single-party state, go much broader and deeper than mere sensor balloons. Such efforts include human intelligence gathering, transnational repression schemes, cyber theft and hacking, intellectual property theft, and even the harvesting of Americans‚Äô genetic material.In the words of one retired Air Force General, ‚ÄúIf [the CCP has] any access to American society, then they‚Äôll use that access to undermine American society.‚ÄùHUMINT and Transnational RepressionKey among the CCP‚Äôs efforts to spy on the United States is its traditional human intelligence (HUMINT) efforts, which relies on person-to-person exchanges of information, both wittingly and otherwise.The CCP‚Äôs HUMINT network permeates American society at many levels, with many such efforts being overseen directly by the regime‚Äôs top intelligence agency, the Ministry of State Security (MSS).One of the most infamous such cases is that of Christine Fang or ‚ÄúFang Fang‚Äù, the alleged Chinese spy who posed as a university student, and fostered relationships with numerous politicians in California and elsewhere, including Rep. Eric Swalwell when he was a city council member, and used that access to collect intelligence on up and coming politicos. Fang reportedly targeted at least two Midwestern mayors with whom she had romantic or sexual relationships.Politicians aren‚Äôt the only targets of such espionage, however. Many everyday Americans, particularly those of Chinese descent, are frequently the preferred targets of the CCP‚Äôs spy and harassment campaigns.In such efforts, MSS agents and their U.S. proxies have allegedly stalked an American Olympic figure skater and her family, conspired with New York police officers to gather intelligence on the Asian American community, and even plotted to attack a U.S. Army veteran running for Congress in a bid to silence and intimidate people holding critical views of the CCP.FBI Director Christopher Wray testified that Chinese agents and their proxies actively stalked U.S. residents and planted bugs in their cars and homes.Cyber Theft and HackingSimilarly, the regime has used cyber attacks and misinformation campaigns to illicitly collect U.S. defense information and sow division among American citizens.U.S. intelligence leaders have identified the CCP as the world‚Äôs largest malicious cyber actor, and its affiliated hackers have stolen more data from Americans than every other nation combined.Such efforts are often aimed at stealing vital technological secrets, such as when suspected state-backed agents hacked into a U.S. government department last year and stole sensitive defense information. Likewise, CCP-sponsored hackers have penetrated and stolen sensitive information from multiple U.S. telecom firms.The incidents highlight what U.S. defense officials have long warned: that the regime is studying how the United States fights with the intent of developing technologies capable of toppling its military and forcibly transferring cutting-edge American technologies to China.Americans‚Äô sensitive personal information is also a valued target, as evidenced by multiple massive hacks by Chinese actors over the years, including the breaches of the U.S. Office of Personnel Management, credit-reporting agency Equifax, Mariott hotels, and insurer Anthem. These hacks resulted in hundreds of millions of Americans‚Äô personal data being stolen.Officials and experts have said the regime is using this massive trove of Americans‚Äô personal data to aid in its espionage and overseas influence operations, and feed its artificial intelligence technology.Social Media and TelecommunicationsThe CCP also uses its control over the data of Chinese companies to leverage Chinese-owned social media and telecommunications giants against an unsuspecting American populace.TikTok, a popular short video app owned by Chinese tech giant ByteDance, is perhaps the most telling example of this.Described by intelligence leaders as a ‚Äúnational security threat‚Äù and labeled by security experts as a ‚Äúweaponized military application,‚Äù social media giant TikTok has censored stories Americans see at the request of the CCP and has allowed its Chinese engineers access to U.S. user data. Officials have repeatedly sounded the alarm about the app because CCP law mandates Chinese companies provide data to the regime upon request.

#China #Espionage
Not Just the Spy Balloons: The CCP‚Äôs Expansive Spy Campaign Against America
Epoch Times ^ | 02/06/2023 | Andrew Thornebrooke
https://www.theepochtimes.com/not-just-balloons-the-ccps-expansive-spy-campaign-against-america_5032375.html?utm_source=partner&utm_campaign=ZeroHedge&src_src=partner&src_cmp=ZeroHedge

News that the Pentagon was tracking a Chinese communist spy balloon hovering over the United States this week is raising concerns about the extent of China‚Äôs espionage efforts against America and its citizens.

But just how far is the regime willing to go in order to spy on and undermine the United States?

The espionage efforts of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP), which rules China as a single-party state, go much broader and deeper than mere sensor balloons. Such efforts include human intelligence gathering, transnational repression schemes, cyber theft and hacking, intellectual property theft, and even the harvesting of Americans‚Äô genetic material.

In the words of one retired Air Force General, ‚ÄúIf [the CCP has] any access to American society, then they‚Äôll use that access to undermine American society.‚Äù

HUMINT and Transnational Repression
Key among the CCP‚Äôs efforts to spy on the United States is its traditional human intelligence (HUMINT) efforts, which relies on person-to-person exchanges of information, both wittingly and otherwise.

The CCP‚Äôs HUMINT network permeates American society at many levels, with many such efforts being overseen directly by the regime‚Äôs top intelligence agency, the Ministry of State Security (MSS).

One of the most infamous such cases is that of Christine Fang or ‚ÄúFang Fang‚Äù, the alleged Chinese spy who posed as a university student, and fostered relationships with numerous politicians in California and elsewhere, including Rep. Eric Swalwell when he was a city council member, and used that access to collect intelligence on up and coming politicos. Fang reportedly targeted at least two Midwestern mayors with whom she had romantic or sexual relationships.

Politicians aren‚Äôt the only targets of such espionage, however. Many everyday Americans, particularly those of Chinese descent, are frequently the preferred targets of the CCP‚Äôs spy and harassment campaigns.

In such efforts, MSS agents and their U.S. proxies have allegedly stalked an American Olympic figure skater and her family, conspired with New York police officers to gather intelligence on the Asian American community, and even plotted to attack a U.S. Army veteran running for Congress in a bid to silence and intimidate people holding critical views of the CCP.

FBI Director Christopher Wray testified that Chinese agents and their proxies actively stalked U.S. residents and planted bugs in their cars and homes.

Cyber Theft and Hacking
Similarly, the regime has used cyber attacks and misinformation campaigns to illicitly collect U.S. defense information and sow division among American citizens.

U.S. intelligence leaders have identified the CCP as the world‚Äôs largest malicious cyber actor, and its affiliated hackers have stolen more data from Americans than every other nation combined.

Such efforts are often aimed at stealing vital technological secrets, such as when suspected state-backed agents hacked into a U.S. government department last year and stole sensitive defense information. Likewise, CCP-sponsored hackers have penetrated and stolen sensitive information from multiple U.S. telecom firms.

The incidents highlight what U.S. defense officials have long warned: that the regime is studying how the United States fights with the intent of developing technologies capable of toppling its military and forcibly transferring cutting-edge American technologies to China.

Americans‚Äô sensitive personal information is also a valued target, as evidenced by multiple massive hacks by Chinese actors over the years, including the breaches of the U.S. Office of Personnel Management, credit-reporting agency Equifax, Mariott hotels, and insurer Anthem. These hacks resulted in hundreds of millions of Americans‚Äô personal data being stolen.

Officials and experts have said the regime is using this massive trove of Americans‚Äô personal data to aid in its espionage and overseas influence operations, and feed its artificial intelligence technology.

Social Media and Telecommunications
The CCP also uses its control over the data of Chinese companies to leverage Chinese-owned social media and telecommunications giants against an unsuspecting American populace.

TikTok, a popular short video app owned by Chinese tech giant ByteDance, is perhaps the most telling example of this.

Described by intelligence leaders as a ‚Äúnational security threat‚Äù and labeled by security experts as a ‚Äúweaponized military application,‚Äù social media giant TikTok has censored stories Americans see at the request of the CCP and has allowed its Chinese engineers access to U.S. user data. Officials have repeatedly sounded the alarm about the app because CCP law mandates Chinese companies provide data to the regime upon request.
